Most Illustrious Sir

In response to your letter of the 8th of the current month addressed to the collector of Jaguarão, and another from him to the Inspector of the Treasury, I must make you aware that Your Grace

Without diminishing the army, it is quite possible to fund the indispensable work of that fiscal office with men unfit for the campaign, who commonly abound in the districts; it is from among these that Your Grace

The nature and extent of our line with the neighboring State, as you know, invites smuggling; it is to prevent it, it is to impose deterrence, that the government devotes its activity and good intentions to this important branch of public service, in the part that concerns it.

God keep Your Grace. Secretariat of the Treasury, Piratini, April 17, 1838. Domingos José de Almeida

To citizen Vasco Madruga de Bitancurt, Justice of the Peace of Erval. From the Ministry of the Treasury.
